body:
# NATS - Crystal Client

Simple NATS client for the [Crystal](https://crystal-lang.org) programming language.

[![License Apache 2](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-Apache2-blue.svg)](https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0)
[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/nats-io/nats.cr.svg?branch=master)](http://travis-ci.org/nats-io/nats.cr)

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

```yaml
   dependencies:
     nats:
       github: nats-io/nats.cr
```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

```crystal
require "nats/client"

client = NATS::Client.new("nats://localhost:4222")
client.connect

client.subscribe("foo") do |msg|
  puts "Received message on subject #{msg.subject}: #{msg.payload}"
end

client.publish("foo", "Hello, NATS!")

client.subscribe("bar") do |msg|
  msg.reply "Received your message on bar: #{msg.payload}"
end

response = client.request("bar", "Hello, bar!")
puts "Received response: #{response.payload}"

client.request("bar") do |msg|
  puts "Recieved async response: #{msg.payload}"
end

client.close
```

## License

Unless otherwise noted, the NATS source files are distributed under
the Apache Version 2.0 license found in the LICENSE file.

class_methods.name: connect
class_methods.doc:
Connects to a NATS server using the provided URI.

*uri*: The URI of the NATS server to connect to.
class_methods.summary: Connects to a NATS server using the provided URI.
class_methods.args_html: (uri : String | URI = Client::DEFAULT_URI) : Client

types.name: AuthenticationError
types.doc: +AuthenticationError+ is raised when the NATS server indicates an authentication error.
types.summary: +AuthenticationError+ is raised when the NATS server indicates an authentication error.

types.name: Client
types.doc:
NATS Client for connecting to a NATS server.\
This client allows you to subscribe and publish messages.

Example:
```
require "nats/client"

client = NATS::Client.new("nats://localhost:4222")
client.connect

client.subscribe("foo") do |msg|
  puts "Received message on subject #{msg.subject}: #{msg.payload}"
end

client.publish("foo", "Hello, NATS!")

client.subscribe("bar") do |msg|
  msg.reply "Received your message on bar: #{msg.payload}"
end

response = client.request("bar", "Hello, bar!")
puts "Received response: #{response.payload}"

client.request("bar") do |msg|
  puts "Recieved async response: #{msg.payload}"
end

client.close
```
types.summary: NATS Client for connecting to a NATS server.\ This client allows you to subscribe and publish messages.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (uri : String | URI = DEFAULT_URI, options : Options = Options.new, user : String | Nil = nil, pass : String | Nil = nil, jwt : String | Nil = nil)
constructors.args_html: (uri : String | URI = DEFAULT_URI, options : Options = Options.new, user : String | Nil = nil, pass : String | Nil = nil, jwt : String | Nil = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(uri, options, user, pass, jwt)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: close
instance_methods.doc: Closes the NATS connection and cleans up resources.
instance_methods.summary: Closes the NATS connection and cleans up resources.

def.name: close

instance_methods.name: connect
instance_methods.doc: Connects to the NATS server
instance_methods.summary: Connects to the NATS server

def.name: connect
def.body:
@status = Status::CONNECTING
setup_socket


handle_info(parse_info(@socket.read_line))


send_connect
first_connection_ok?
@status = Status::CONNECTED


spawn(handle_messages)

spawn(flush)

self

instance_methods.name: connected?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the client is connected to the NATS server.\
Will send a PING message and wait for a PONG response.
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the client is connected to the NATS server.\ Will send a PING message and wait for a PONG response.

def.name: connected?
def.body:
if status == Status::CLOSED
  return false
end

channel = Channel(Nil).new
@pongs.push(channel)
send_msg!("PING")
spawn do
  sleep(@options.timeout)
  channel.close
end
begin
  channel.receive
rescue
  {raise(TimeoutError.new("PING timeout"))}
end
true

instance_methods.name: publish
instance_methods.doc:
Publishes a message to the specified subject.

*subject*: The subject to publish to.\
*payload*: The message payload.
instance_methods.summary: Publishes a message to the specified subject.

def.name: publish
def.body:
if status == Status::CLOSED
  raise(ClientClosedError.new)
end

msg = Message::PUB.new(subject: subject, payload: payload)
send_msg!(msg.to_s)

instance_methods.name: request
instance_methods.doc:
Publishes a message to the specified subject and waits for a response.

*subject*: The subject to publish to.\
*payload*: The message payload.\
*timeout*: Optional timeout for waiting for a response. Will use `Options.timeout` if not set.
instance_methods.summary: Publishes a message to the specified subject and waits for a response.
instance_methods.args_string: (subject : String, payload : String, timeout : Time::Span | Nil = nil) : Message::MSG
instance_methods.args_html: (subject : String, payload : String, timeout : Time::Span | Nil = nil) : Message::MSG

def.name: request
def.body:
begin
  if status == Status::CLOSED
    raise(ClientClosedError.new)
  end

  msg = Message::PUB.new(subject: subject, reply_to: new_inbox, payload: payload)
  send_msg!(msg.to_s)
  channel = Channel(Message::MSG).new
  reply_sub = subscribe(msg.reply_to.to_s) do |response_msg|
    channel.send(response_msg)
  end
  spawn do
    sleep(timeout || @options.timeout)
    channel.close
  end

  begin
    channel.receive
  rescue
    raise(TimeoutError.new("Request Timeout"))
  end
ensure
  if @subs.has_key?(reply_sub.try(&.sid))
    @subs[reply_sub.try(&.sid)].unsubscribe
  end
  if reply_sub.try(&.sid)
    @subs.delete(reply_sub.try(&.sid))
  end
end

instance_methods.name: request
instance_methods.doc:
Publishes a message to the specified subject and sends response to callback when available.

*subject*: The subject to publish to.\
*payload*: The message payload.\
*callback*: Callback to handle the response message.
instance_methods.summary: Publishes a message to the specified subject and sends response to callback when available.

def.name: request
def.body:
if status == Status::CLOSED
  raise(ClientClosedError.new)
end

msg = Message::PUB.new(subject: subject, reply_to: new_inbox, payload: payload)
send_msg(msg.to_s)
spawn do
  begin
    channel = Channel(Message::MSG).new
    reply_sub = subscribe(msg.reply_to.to_s) do |response_msg|
      channel.send(response_msg)
    end
    callback.call(channel.receive)
  ensure
    if @subs.has_key?(reply_sub.try(&.sid))
      @subs[reply_sub.try(&.sid)].unsubscribe
    end
    if reply_sub.try(&.sid)
      @subs.delete(reply_sub.try(&.sid))
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: status
instance_methods.doc: The current status of the client connection.
instance_methods.summary: The current status of the client connection.

instance_methods.name: subscribe
instance_methods.doc:
Subscribe to a subject, messages will be delivered to the provided callback.

*subject*: The subject to subscribe to.\
*queue_group*: Optional queue group for load balancing.\
*callback*: The callback to handle incoming messages.
instance_methods.summary: Subscribe to a subject, messages will be delivered to the provided callback.
instance_methods.args_string: (subject : String, queue_group : String | Nil = nil, &callback : Message::MSG -> Nil) : Subscription
instance_methods.args_html: (subject : String, queue_group : String | Nil = nil, &callback : Message::MSG -> Nil) : Subscription

def.name: subscribe
def.body:
if status == Status::CLOSED
  raise(ClientClosedError.new)
end

sid = next_sid
sub = Subscription.new(subject: subject, sid: sid, callback: callback, client: self, queue_group: queue_group)

msg = Message::SUB.new(subject: subject, queue_group: queue_group, sid: sid.to_s)
send_msg!(msg.to_s)
@subs[sid] = sub

instance_methods.name: unsubscribe
instance_methods.doc:
Unsubscribes from a subject.

*sub*: The subscription to unsubscribe from.
instance_methods.summary: Unsubscribes from a subject.

def.name: unsubscribe
def.body:
if status == Status::CLOSED
  raise(ClientClosedError.new)
end

sid = sub.sid
unsub = Message::UNSUB.new(sid: sid.to_s)
send_msg!(unsub.to_s)
@subs.delete(sid)

constants.doc: When the client is not actively connected.
constants.summary: When the client is not actively connected.

constants.name: CLOSED
constants.doc: When the client will no longer attempt to connect to a NATS Server.
constants.summary: When the client will no longer attempt to connect to a NATS Server.

constants.doc: When the client has disconnected and is attempting to reconnect.
constants.summary: When the client has disconnected and is attempting to reconnect.

constants.name: CONNECTING
constants.doc: When the client is attempting to connect to a NATS Server for the first time.
constants.summary: When the client is attempting to connect to a NATS Server for the first time.

constants.doc: When the client is draining a connection before closing.
constants.summary: When the client is draining a connection before closing.

types.name: ClientClosedError
types.doc:
+ClientClosed+ is raised when `NATS::Client.status == +NATS::Client::Status::CLOSED`\
Usually due to the socket being closed.
types.summary: +ClientClosed+ is raised when NATS::Client.status == +NATS::Client::Status::CLOSED\ Usually due to the socket being closed.

types.name: ERRError
types.doc: +-ERR+ is raised when the NATS server indicates a protocol error.
types.summary: +-ERR+ is raised when the NATS server indicates a protocol error.

types.name: CONNECT
types.doc:
The CONNECT message is the client version of the INFO message.\
Once the client has established a TCP/IP socket connection with the NATS server,
  and an INFO message has been received from the server,
  the client may send a CONNECT message to the NATS server to provide more
  information about the current connection as well as security information.

SEE: https://docs.nats.io/reference/reference-protocols/nats-protocol#connect
types.summary: The CONNECT message is the client version of the INFO message.\ Once the client has established a TCP/IP socket connection with the NATS server, and an INFO message has been received from the server, the client may send a CONNECT message to the NATS server to provide more information about the current connection as well as security information.

instance_methods.name: echo
instance_methods.doc:
If set to false, the server (version 1.2.0+) will not send originating messages from this connection to its own subscriptions.
Clients should set this to false only for server supporting this feature,
  which is when proto in the INFO protocol is set to at least `1`.
instance_methods.summary: If set to false, the server (version 1.2.0+) will not send originating messages from this connection to its own subscriptions.

Clients should set this to false only for server supporting this feature,
  which is when proto in the INFO protocol is set to at least `1`.
instance_methods.summary: If set to false, the server (version 1.2.0+) will not send originating messages from this connection to its own subscriptions.

instance_methods.name: protocol
instance_methods.doc:
Sending `0` (or absent) indicates client supports original protocol.
Sending `1` indicates that the client supports dynamic reconfiguration
  of cluster topology changes by asynchronously receiving INFO messages with known servers it can reconnect to.
TODO: Support dynamic reconfiguration in the future
instance_methods.summary: Sending 0 (or absent) indicates client supports original protocol.

instance_methods.name: protocol=
instance_methods.doc:
Sending `0` (or absent) indicates client supports original protocol.
Sending `1` indicates that the client supports dynamic reconfiguration
  of cluster topology changes by asynchronously receiving INFO messages with known servers it can reconnect to.
TODO: Support dynamic reconfiguration in the future
instance_methods.summary: Sending 0 (or absent) indicates client supports original protocol.

In case the server has responded with a nonce on INFO,

Returns a nicely readable and concise string representation of this object,
typically intended for users.

This method should usually **not** be overridden. It delegates to
`#to_s(IO)` which can be overridden for custom implementations.

Also see `#inspect`.

types.name: INFO
types.doc:
A client will need to start as a plain TCP connection,
  then when the server accepts a connection from the client,
  it will send information about itself,
  the configuration and security requirements necessary for the client to successfully authenticate with the server and exchange messages.

When using the updated client protocol (see `CONNECT`),
  INFO messages can be sent anytime by the server.
  This means clients with that protocol level need to be able to asynchronously handle INFO messages.

SEE: https://docs.nats.io/reference/reference-protocols/nats-protocol#info
types.summary: A client will need to start as a plain TCP connection, then when the server accepts a connection from the client, it will send information about itself, the configuration and security requirements necessary for the client to successfully authenticate with the server and exchange messages.

instance_methods.name: tls_required
instance_methods.doc:
If this is true, then the client must perform the TLS/1.2 handshake.
Note, this used to be ssl_required and has been updated along with the protocol from SSL to TLS.
instance_methods.summary: If this is true, then the client must perform the TLS/1.2 handshake.

types.name: MSG
types.doc:
The MSG protocol message is used to deliver an application message to the client.

SEE: https://docs.nats.io/reference/reference-protocols/nats-protocol#msg
types.summary: The MSG protocol message is used to deliver an application message to the client.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (subject : String, sid : Int64, reply_to : String | Nil = nil, bytes : Int64 = 0, payload : String | Nil = nil, client : Client | Nil = nil)
constructors.args_html: (subject : String, sid : Int64, reply_to : String | Nil = nil, bytes : Int64 = 0, payload : String | Nil = nil, client : Client | Nil = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(subject, sid, reply_to, bytes, payload, client)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: client
instance_methods.doc: NATS Client for sending replies.
instance_methods.summary: NATS Client for sending replies.

instance_methods.name: client=
instance_methods.doc: NATS Client for sending replies.
instance_methods.summary: NATS Client for sending replies.

instance_methods.name: payload
instance_methods.doc: The message payload data.
instance_methods.summary: The message payload data.

instance_methods.name: payload=
instance_methods.doc: The message payload data.
instance_methods.summary: The message payload data.

instance_methods.name: reply
instance_methods.doc:
Reply to this message when the reply_to subject is set.

*payload*: The payload to send in the reply.
instance_methods.summary: Reply to this message when the reply_to subject is set.

def.name: reply
def.body:
if reply_to
  msg = PUB.new(subject: reply_to.to_s, payload: payload)

  @client.try(&.send_msg!(msg.to_s))
else
  raise(MSGError.new("reply_to is nil"))
end

types.name: PUB
types.doc:
The PUB message publishes the message payload to the given subject name, optionally supplying a reply subject.\
If a reply subject is supplied, it will be delivered to eligible subscribers along with the supplied payload.

NOTE: that the payload itself is optional.

SEE: https://docs.nats.io/reference/reference-protocols/nats-protocol#pub
types.summary: The PUB message publishes the message payload to the given subject name, optionally supplying a reply subject.\ If a reply subject is supplied, it will be delivered to eligible subscribers along with the supplied payload.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (subject : String, reply_to : String | Nil = nil, payload : String | Nil = nil, callback : Message::MSG -> Nil | Nil = nil)
constructors.args_html: (subject : String, reply_to : String | Nil = nil, payload : String | Nil = nil, callback : Message::MSG -> Nil | Nil = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(subject, reply_to, payload, callback)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

types.name: UNSUB
types.doc:
UNSUB unsubscribes the connection from the specified subject,
  or auto-unsubscribes after the specified number of messages has been received.

SEE: https://docs.nats.io/reference/reference-protocols/nats-protocol#unsub
types.summary: UNSUB unsubscribes the connection from the specified subject, or auto-unsubscribes after the specified number of messages has been received.

types.name: NUID
types.doc:
Copied and modified from nats-pure repo.

SEE: https://github.com/nats-io/nats-pure.rb/blob/master/lib/nats/nuid.rb

def.name: next
def.body:
@seq = @seq + @inc
if @seq >= MAX_SEQ
  reset!
end
l = @seq




s_10 = DIGITS[l % BASE]

s_09, s_08, s_07, s_06, s_05, s_04, s_03, s_02, s_01 = (l = l // BASE
DIGITS[l % BASE]), (l = l // BASE
DIGITS[l % BASE]), (l = l // BASE
DIGITS[l % BASE]), (l = l // BASE
DIGITS[l % BASE]), (l = l // BASE
DIGITS[l % BASE]), (l = l // BASE
DIGITS[l % BASE]), (l = l // BASE
DIGITS[l % BASE]), (l = l // BASE
DIGITS[l % BASE]), (l = l // BASE
DIGITS[l % BASE])
"#{@prefix}#{s_01}#{s_02}#{s_03}#{s_04}#{s_05}#{s_06}#{s_07}#{s_08}#{s_09}#{s_10}"

def.name: randomize_prefix!

if _.responds_to?(:finalize)

end
